content: How can I view the current version of packages installed by pipenv using the command line? I know I can examine the Pipfile.lock, but I'm looking for a simpler way.

To view the current version of packages installed by `pipenv`, you can use the following command in your terminal:

```bash
pipenv graph
```

This command will display a dependency graph of all the packages installed in your virtual environment along with their versions. It's a convenient way to see the package versions without manually inspecting the `Pipfile.lock`.
